DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy Aspartic Acid Choline Metabolite Ratio Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Value for the ratio of brain metabolites N-acetylaspartate and Choline as a measure of function in an individual undergoing an MR imaging scan. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy Aspartic Acid Choline Ratio
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Detection and measurement of the resonant spectra of molecular species in a tissue or sample._A non-essential amino acid in humans, Aspartic Acid has an overall negative charge and plays an important role in the synthesis of other amino acids and in the citric acid and urea cycles. Asparagine, arginine, lysine, methionine, isoleucine, and some nucleotides are synthesized from aspartic acid. Aspartic acid also serves as a neurotransmitter. (NCI04)_Water-soluble vitamin that is a precursor for acetylcholine, phospholipids, and the methyl donor betaine. (DRI)_Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Detection and measurement of the resonant spectra of molecular species in a tissue or sample.

Concepts.definition: Detection and measurement of the resonant spectra of molecular species in a tissue or sample.

Property.preferredDefinition: A non-essential amino acid in humans, Aspartic Acid has an overall negative charge and plays an important role in the synthesis of other amino acids and in the citric acid and urea cycles. Asparagine, arginine, lysine, methionine, isoleucine, and some nucleotides are synthesized from aspartic acid. Aspartic acid also serves as a neurotransmitter. (NCI04):Water-soluble vitamin that is a precursor for acetylcholine, phospholipids, and the methyl donor betaine. (DRI):The ratio of two or more signals, typically between two channels.  Of type float. (caMAGE)

Concepts.definition: A non-essential amino acid in humans, Aspartic Acid has an overall negative charge and plays an important role in the synthesis of other amino acids and in the citric acid and urea cycles. Asparagine, arginine, lysine, methionine, isoleucine, and some nucleotides are synthesized from aspartic acid. Aspartic acid also serves as a neurotransmitter. (NCI04)
Water-soluble vitamin that is a precursor for acetylcholine, phospholipids, and the methyl donor betaine. (DRI)
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
